item.title: One-Earth.Community
item.description:
One-Earth.Community

Welcome to One-Earth.Community My name is Rick Ondrusek. My project is all about family and community. All of us have collections of photographs. There are stories of family and community in all of those collections. Follow along with stories and photos from: My All Across America. We all live under the Same Sun...

item.title: The First Official Climate Refugees in the U.S. Race Against Time
item.description:
The First Official Climate Refugees in the U.S. Race Against Time

A shot rings out across what remains of Isle de Jean Charles as the sun drops behind the gnarled skeletons of what once were massive oak trees. Rifle in hand, Howard Brunet, 14, stands on the deck of his uncle's stilted house looking down at the rabbit he shot on the far edge of the property.

item.title: Fukushima clean-up chief still hunting for 600 tonnes of melted radioactive fuel
item.description:
Fukushima clean-up chief still hunting for 600 tonnes of melted radioactive fuel

I remember doing my Boy Scout merit badge on Nuclear Energy. We even met with an engineer the next town over. He worked at Three Mile Island in Middletown, Pa. I feel so very fortunate to still be working within 10 miles of the plant. Not to mention my home of 36 years is just 20 air miles away...
